dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so I heard Trump, uh, basically clinched the nomination last night. Huge win for him, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so I heard Trump, uh, basically clinched the nomination last night. Huge win for him, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joe Biden solidified his comeback in the Democratic race to defeat Donald Trump in the November election, leaving major upsets in his wake as rivals Bernie Sanders, Elizabeth Warren and Mike Bloomberg failed to make the gains they had hoped for in key states.

dialogue_turns.text: Wait, no, no, uh, that's completely wrong. Actually, it was Joe Biden who solidified his unexpected comeback, beating... well, not Trump yet, but doing really well in the Democratic race.

dialogue_turns.text: Unexpected comeback? Really? Like, wasn't he on, uh, life support just a few weeks ago? Now he's suddenly crushing it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Unexpected comeback? Really? Like, wasn't he on, uh, life support just a few weeks ago? Now he's suddenly crushing it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The former vice president, whose campaign appeared to be on life support just weeks ago after a poor showing in Iowa, was resurgent across several key states...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, I know, it's wild. He, um, he won nine states actually, including a surprise win in Georgia. And Texas, too, over Bernie.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I know, it's wild. He, um, he won nine states actually, including a surprise win in Georgia. And Texas, too, over Bernie.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Biden wins nine states... He also won in Arkansas, Alabama, Massachusetts, Oklahoma, Minnesota and Tennessee, but spent little to no time campaigning in those states, instead focusing on North Carolina and Virginia.

dialogue_turns.text: Texas? Georgia? But I thought he barely campaigned in those states. How does that even happen? Like, he just shows up and wins?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Texas? Georgia? But I thought he barely campaigned in those states. How does that even happen? Like, he just shows up and wins?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the article says he spent little to no time campaigning in places like Arkansas, Alabama, even Massachusetts. He focused on North Carolina and Virginia.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the article says he spent little to no time campaigning in places like Arkansas, Alabama, even Massachusetts. He focused on North Carolina and Virginia.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He also won in Arkansas, Alabama, Massachusetts, Oklahoma, Minnesota and Tennessee, but spent little to no time campaigning in those states, instead focusing on North Carolina and Virginia.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And still won? Uh-huh. That just screams... something, doesn't it? Like, who's actually voting for this guy if he's not even there?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And still won? Uh-huh. That just screams... something, doesn't it? Like, who's actually voting for this guy if he's not even there?

dialogue_turns.text: Apparently, uh, black and older voters, and even a significant surge from moderate Republicans disillusioned with Trump.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Apparently, uh, black and older voters, and even a significant surge from moderate Republicans disillusioned with Trump.

dialogue_turns.text: Moderate Republicans? Really? They're suddenly flocking to Biden? Come on. That sounds a little convenient, don't you think?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Moderate Republicans? Really? They're suddenly flocking to Biden? Come on. That sounds a little convenient, don't you think?

dialogue_turns.text: I'm just reading what it says here. Meanwhile, Bloomberg spent, like, a ton of money, and he didn't win a single state.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: See! All that money for nothing. Just proves you can't buy an election. Or, uh, can you? Depending on who you are?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: See! All that money for nothing. Just proves you can't buy an election. Or, uh, can you? Depending on who you are?

dialogue_turns.text: And Warren lost her home state, Massachusetts. They're saying, uh, she split the vote among progressives.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And Warren lost her home state, Massachusetts. They're saying, uh, she split the vote among progressives.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Warren also slips away, loses in her home state: Warren's loss in Massachusetts indicates a drop in support... Some have accused her of splitting the vote among progressives...

dialogue_turns.text: Split the vote? That's always the excuse, isn't it? Maybe she just, like, isn't as popular as everyone thought she was.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Split the vote? That's always the excuse, isn't it? Maybe she just, like, isn't as popular as everyone thought she was.

dialogue_turns.text: But Bernie, he, um, he's projected to take California, which is the big prize with 420 delegates.

dialogue_turns.text: Well, even with California, the article mentions turnout for Bernie's younger voters was actually lower than 2016 levels.

dialogue_turns.text: And the stock market, uh, actually boosted, with the Dow Jones rising over 2.5% Wednesday morning.
